VETERANS ADMINISTRATION
Washington 25# 0. C.
February 26, 1953
In Reply refer to* 6GA
Mr. Frank E. Schooley
Executive Director
ifttMonnl Association of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley j
Thank you for your recent letter concerning the NAEB taped program
series, WAYS OF MANKIND, and for forwarding three programs for
auditioning purposes. We have enjoyed these very much within our
own office, and believe they might be most suitable if our limited
budget could afford our adding them to the transcribed and taped
programs presently furnished our hospital broadcasting systems.
Before any final determination can be made, we should like to play
the programs for members of the staff of the Department of Madicine
and Surgery, and, in addition, we should have to examine the cost
in the light of our limited budget for such program aids.
We ahall return the tapes as soon as we have been able to arrange
for the above mentioned medical staff auditions, and we will let you
know our decision concerning your kind offer of availability of
these tapes as soon as possible. Your interest in our recreation
program for hospitalised veterans is appreciated.
Sincerely yours,
/s/ Joseph N. Conlin
Joseph N. Conlin
Chief of Entertainment
Recreation Service
Special Services
